alert.note: Alert for Bond; Clinton; Fayette; Marion; Randolph; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 8:49PM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Illinois. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until Noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from Noon Friday to Noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Bond; Clinton; Fayette; Marion; Randolph; Washington
